{{infobox character | people=[[Hobbits|Hobbit]] | name=Isumbras Took I | image=Gregor Roffalski - Isumbras Took I.jpg | caption="Isumbras Took I" by [[:Category:Images by Gregor Roffalski|Gregor Roffalski]] | pronun= | othernames= | titles=[[Thain]] of [[the Shire]] | position= | location=[[The Shire]] | affiliation= | language= | birth=before {{SR|740}} | birthlocation= | rule=from {{SR|740}} | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | family=[[Took Family|Took]] | parentage= | siblings= | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Isumbras Took''' was a the thirteenth [[Thain]] of [[the Shire]]. ==History== Isumbras was elected Thain in {{SR|740}},{{App|TA}} after [[Gorhendad Oldbuck]] relocated to [[Buckland]].{{FR|I5}} From then on, the Thain was a title held by the [[Took Family]].{{App|Took}} ==Etymology== "Isumbras" is of French and [[Old English|Anglo-Saxon]] origin and means "iron-arm". It comes from the French ''bras'' meaning "arm", and the Anglo-Saxon and Middle High German word ''[[isen]]'' which means "iron".[[Jim Allan]], ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names" [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] likely got the name from ''[[wikipedia:Sir Isumbras|Sir Isumbras]]'', an English medieval romance about a man who suffers a lifetime of hardship but who finds happiness in his latter years. {{references}} {{seq-start}} {{seq-head | race=hobbit | house=[[Took Family]] | born=Before {{SR|740}} | died=After {{SR|740}} }} {{Seq | prev=[[Gorhendad Oldbuck]] | list=13th [[Thain]] of [[The Shire]] | dates={{SR|740}} - unknown | nvac=[[Isumbras Took II|Unknown]] | next=Next known:
[[Isengrim Took II]] }} {{seq-end}} {{seq-end}} {{thains}} [[Category:Germanic names]] [[Category:Hobbits]] [[Category:Thains]] [[Category:Third Age characters]] [[Category:Took]]
